00015 /// \file
00016 /// Provides the Array class.
00017 
00018 #ifndef __ARRAY_HPP
00019 #define __ARRAY_HPP
00020 
00021 #include <types.hpp>
00022 #include <memory.hpp>
00023 
00024 /// A simple array.
00025 /**
00026  * \tparam Element The type of elements stored in the array.
00027  */
00028 template<typename Element> class Array {
00029     
00030     protected:
00031         
00032         /// The number of elements in the array.
00033         Size array_size;
00034         
00035         /// A pointer to the first element.
00036         Element * array;
00037         
00038     public:
00039         /// Allocate an array of the specified size, or an empty one when the size is omitted.
00040         /**
00041          * All elements will be constructed with their default constructor.
00042          */
00043         explicit Array(Size size = 0) : array(0) { reset(size); }
00044         
00045         /// Reset the array.
00046         /**
00047          * All elements will be deconstructed and the array will be deallocated.
00048          * If a new size is given, new elements will be allocated and constructed with their default constructor.
00049          *
00050          * \param new_size The new size of the array.
00051          */
00052         inline void reset(Size new_size = 0) {
00053             if (array){
00054                 for(Size i = 0; i < array_size; i++) array[i].~Element();
00055                 Memory<Element>::deallocate(array,array_size);
00056             }
00057             array = new_size ? Memory<Element>::allocate(new_size) : 0;
00058             array_size = new_size;
00059             for(Size i = 0; i < array_size; i++) new (&array[i]) Element();
00060         }
00061         
00062         /// Clear the array.
00063         /**
00064          * All elements will be reset to their default value.
00065          */
00066         inline void clear() {
00067             for(Size i = 0; i < array_size; i++) array[i] = Element();
00068         }
00069         
00070         inline operator Element       * ()       { return array; } ///< Access the elements of the Array.
00071         inline operator Element const * () const { return array; } ///< Constant access to the elements of the Array. 
00072         
00073         /// The number of elements in the array.
00074         inline Size size() { return array_size; }
00075         
00076         /// Deconstruct the elements and deallocate the array.
00077         inline ~Array() { reset(); }
00078         
00079 };
00080 
00081 #endif
